intro: Machaeranthera attenuata, commonly known as the slenderleaf tansy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in open woodlands and rocky soils. Machaeranthera attenuata is notable for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its use in traditional herbal medicine.
